page.title: 09FARMING WINTERBOURNE VALLEY
page.content: {CROPS}Grassland managed for hay,silage and grazing{FODDER CROPS}Turnips,kale, rape & beet grown for feeding cattle & sheep. Sometimes maize is grown and when nearly ripe, cut and chopped by Forage harvester to make silage which is stored in clamps for winter feeding {CASH CROPS}Wheat:a soft grain sold for biscuit-making flour. Barley: malting quality sold for brewing also export. Some to seed merchants. All poorer grain sold for stock-feed mixtures. {MACHINERY PRICES} Slurry tanker Â£5000 Plough Â£5500 Seed drill Â£3257 115hp Tractor Â£26000 Round baler Â£9000 Forage harvester Â£5526 Mower Â£6180 Bale loader Â£2734 Bale grapple Â£415 5m-cut Combine harvester Â£47000 {LIVESTOCK PRICES} Breeding pig Â£294 Ewe Â£56-Â£70 Pedigree Ram Â£200 Fat lambs Â£1.99/kilo Diary cow Â£740
